text:
I am running a benchmark which is fetching binary data from a servlet
repeatedly.

I find that each request takes about 100ms more when the ajp13 connector is used
compared to ajp12.
creator: rde@webtrak.co.uk
rde@webtrak.co.uk
text:
This is another TCP delay problem.

Adding:

 	    socket.setTcpNoDelay(true);

to processConnection in Ajp13ConnectionHandler seems to fix the performance
problem.

creator: lichtin@bivio.com
text:
I can confirm ajp13 to be kinda slow in 3.2.1. The "setTcpNoDelay"
fix suggested by Richard doesn't seem to be in 3.2.2, any reason 
why it wasn't applied?

Fixed for TC3.3 ( at least setting the option ). On my system, Ajp13 is 
significantly faster - but on some systems it may be a matter of options. Now
all socket options are settable.
